item.title: 澳大利亚收紧银行高风险抵押贷款规则
item.description: 澳大利亚银行业监管机构收紧了对银行抵押贷款的规定，以求先发制人地遏制高杠杆借款人带来的可能导致房地产市场脆弱的新风险。【原文：Australia’s banking regulator tightened rules on bank lending for mortgages as it seeks to preemptively contain emerging risks from highly leveraged borrowers that could cause vulnerabilities in the housing market.】

item.title: 摩根大通预测美联储将于 12 月降息
item.description: 摩根大通银行（JPMorgan Chase & Co.【原文：Economists at JPMorgan Chase & Co. see the Federal Reserve cutting interest rates next month, a reversal of the bank’s briefly held view that policymakers would delay reducing borrowing costs until January.】

item.title: 实验室内部：教机器人煮咖啡、叠衣服
item.description: 一家成立一年的初创公司正在开发人工智能软件，教机器人如何完成日常任务。但首先...【原文：A year-old startup is finding traction building AI software to teach robots how to tackle everyday tasks. But first…】

item.title: 现代重工称，人工智能为实现特朗普造船目标开辟了更快的道路
item.description: 韩国企业集团 HD Hyundai 看到了通过部署人工智能加速美国造船业复兴的机会。【原文：South Korean conglomerate HD Hyundai sees an opportunity to accelerate America’s shipbuilding revival by deploying artificial intelligence.】

item.title: 黑帮以星巴克和雀巢青睐的哥伦比亚咖啡产区为目标
item.description: 随着安第斯山脉大片地区的治安恶化，生产哥伦比亚最高品质咖啡的农场正成为武装抢劫犯和敲诈勒索者的目标。【原文：Farms that produce some of Colombia’s highest-quality coffee are being targeted by armed robbers and extortionists as security deteriorates across swathes of the Andes.】

item.title: 从戴尔到惠普，科技公司都警告内存芯片将受到人工智能的挤压
item.description: 戴尔科技公司（Dell Technologies Inc.）、惠普公司（HP Inc.【原文：Dell Technologies Inc., HP Inc. and other tech companies are warning of potential memory-chip supply shortages in the coming year due to soaring demand from the buildout of artificial intelligence infrastructure.】

item.title: 乌克兰在面临资金风险的情况下与国际货币基金组织达成 82 亿美元协议
item.description: 国际货币基金组织宣布与乌克兰就一项新的融资计划达成协议，向这个饱受战争蹂躏的国家的国际盟友发出了一个积极的信号。【原文：The International Monetary Fund has announced an agreement with Ukraine on a new financing program, sending a positive signal to the war-torn nation’s international allies.】

item.title: 里夫斯的预算赢得了胜利，但也为未来埋下了隐患
item.description: 财政大臣雷切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）在预算中做了足够多的工作来帮助她和首相基尔-斯塔默（Keir Starmer）生存下去，重新建立了重要的财政缓冲区并扩大了福利。【原文：Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves did enough in her budget to help her and Prime Minister Keir Starmer survive, building back a vital fiscal buffer and expanding welfare.】

item.title: 高盛为泽西城住宅大厦融资 2 亿美元
item.description: 高盛集团正在为新泽西州泽西城一个拥有 360 个单元的住宅项目安排超过 2 亿美元的建设融资，为这个纽约市的邻近地区增加了市场价住房和经济适用房的组合。【原文：Goldman Sachs Group Inc. is arranging more than $200 million of construction financing for a 360-unit residential project in Jersey City, New Jersey, adding a mix of market-rate and affordable housing to the New York City neighbor.】

item.title: 美联储《米色报告》显示消费者 K 型分裂加深
item.description: 美联储表示，最近几周美国经济活动变化不大，但除高端购物者外，总体消费支出进一步下降。【原文：US economic activity was little changed in recent weeks, though overall consumer spending declined further except among higher-end shoppers, the Federal Reserve said.】

item.title: Amundi 对资产所有者重新分配委托 "信心十足
item.description: Amundi SA 表示，由于管理气候风险的愿望日益强烈，机构任务也在不断调整，因此预计将有更多资金流入。【原文：Amundi SA says it’s expecting to see more inflows as a result of what it describes as ongoing adjustments in institutional mandates triggered by a growing desire to manage climate risk.】

item.title: 贝卢斯科尼的 MFE 将收购葡萄牙媒体公司 Impresa 的股份
item.description: 意大利贝卢斯科尼家族控制的广播公司 MFE-MediaForEurope NV 周三表示，已同意收购葡萄牙 Impresa SGPS SA 公司 32.9% 的股份。【原文：MFE-MediaForEurope NV, the broadcaster controlled by Italy’s Berlusconi family, said on Wednesday it has agreed to buy a stake of 32.9% in Portugal’s Impresa SGPS SA.】

item.title: 墨西哥银行将 2025 年墨西哥经济增长预测下调至 0.3
item.description: 墨西哥第三季度经济萎缩，引发了人们对拉美第二大经济体经济衰退的担忧，此后墨西哥央行下调了对今年经济增长的预期。【原文：Mexico’s central bank cut its expectation for growth this year after the economy contracted in the third quarter, igniting recession fears for Latin America’s second-biggest economy.】

item.title: 沃尔沃、特斯拉供应商 Luminar 准备进行债务重组
item.description: 汽车传感器供应商 Luminar Technologies 在数次拖欠利息后，任命了一名高管领导债务解决工作，这是汽车供应商行业陷入困境的最新迹象。【原文：Car sensor supplier Luminar Technologies appointed an executive to lead a debt workout after missing several interest payments, in the latest sign of trouble in the auto supplier industry.】

item.title: 当道富发出关于摩根大通基金的刻薄邮件时
item.description: 专门点竞争对手的名并不常见【原文：It’s not as common to specifically name drop the competition】

item.title: 扬基队季后赛的出色表现使体育场收入增至 3.4 亿美元
item.description: 扬基体育场是纽约扬基棒球队在布朗克斯的主场，今年前九个月的门票销售和套房许可收入近 3.4 亿美元，与 2024 年同期相比略有增长。【原文：Yankee Stadium, the Bronx-based home of the New York Yankees baseball team, pulled in almost $340 million from ticket sales and suite licenses in the first nine months of the year, a small increase on the same period in 2024.】

item.title: 五角大楼在 10 月 7 日的信中引用阿里巴巴关于中国军事援助的说法
item.description: 在唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）和习近平达成广泛的贸易休战协议大约三周前，五角大楼致信国会，认为阿里巴巴集团控股有限公司（Alibaba Group Holding Ltd.）、百度公司（Baidu Inc.【原文：The Pentagon concluded that Alibaba Group Holding Ltd., Baidu Inc. and BYD Co. should be added to a list of companies that aid the Chinese military, according to a letter to Congress sent roughly three weeks before Donald Trump and Xi Jinping agreed to a broad trade truce.】

item.title: 里夫斯通过预算措施为英格兰银行减息扫清障碍
item.description: 雷切尔-里夫斯为英国央行下月恢复降息扫清了道路，尽管她的预算案与几周前的预期相比，通胀打击力度有所减弱。【原文：Rachel Reeves cleared the path for the Bank of England to resume cutting interest rates next month, even though her budget was less inflation-battling than had been expected only a few weeks ago.】

item.title: 比特币突破 90,000 美元，期权指向情绪转变
item.description: 比特币在近一周内首次攀升至 90,000 美元以上，在长达一个多月的大跌后扳回一城，原因是风险资产的广泛反弹和波动性的缓解为交易者提供了推高比特币的空间。【原文：Bitcoin climbed above $90,000 for the first time in almost a week, clawing back ground after a more than a month-long selloff, as a broad rally in risk assets and easing volatility gave traders room to push higher.】

item.title: 预算案公布后贷款人反弹，银行家仍对英国增税耿耿于怀
item.description: 在一些银行股涨至 17 年来最高水平的同时，金融家们却在纠结财政大臣雷切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）支撑英国财政的举措会对他们产生怎样的个人影响。【原文：While some bank stocks rallied to their highest levels in 17 years, financiers were stewing over how they’ll be personally affected by Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves’ moves to shore up the UK’s finances.】

item.title: 莱恩称，工资增长放缓，欧洲央行将把通胀率维持在 2
item.description: 欧洲中央银行首席经济学家菲利普-莱恩（Philip Lane）表示，由于非能源价格趋缓，欧洲中央银行应能将通胀率保持在目标水平。【原文：The European Central Bank should be able to keep inflation at target thanks to a moderation in non-energy prices, according to Chief Economist Philip Lane.】

item.title: 据称 Aegon 将探索剥离资产以加强对美国市场的关注
item.description: 据知情人士透露，Aegon Ltd. 正在探索出售其在美国以外的部分业务，以专注于其最大的市场。【原文：Aegon Ltd. is exploring selling some of its operations outside of the US as it looks to focus on its largest market, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 伦敦一度活跃的股市为何陷入困境？
item.description: 伦敦证券交易所失去了魔力。随着公司选择在其他地方上市、将现有上市地转移到美国以及接受私有化交易，这家拥有 300 多年历史的交易所正在萎缩。【原文：The London Stock Exchange has lost its mojo. The more than 300-year-old bourse is shrinking as companies opt to go public elsewhere, shift their existing listings to the US, and accept deals to be taken private.】

item.title: 财政预算案刺激债券反弹，Vanguard 和皇家伦敦买入英国国债
item.description: 由于英国财政大臣雷切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）的预算案在很大程度上赢得了市场的青睐，先锋集团（Vanguard Group Inc.【原文：Vanguard Group Inc. and Royal London Asset Management Ltd. bought gilts on Wednesday as UK Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves’ budget largely won favor with markets, sparking the biggest rally in longer-dated bonds since April.】

item.title: 私人信贷公司 Permira 有意收购德国旅游公司
item.description: 据私人信贷机构 Permira Credit 称，该公司正在就收购德国旅游运营商 Berge & Meer 进行深入谈判，这是直接贷款机构通过入股支持债务人这一日益增长的趋势的又一迹象。【原文：Private credit lender Permira Credit is in advanced talks to take over German tour operator Berge & Meer, according to the company, another sign of the growing trend of direct lenders moving to take equity positions to support their debtors.】

item.title: Altice International 的次级债权人与杰富瑞、米尔班克合作
item.description: 据熟悉此事的人士透露，Altice International Sarl 的一些无担保债权人在与该公司进行债务谈判之前，已聘请 Jefferies Financial Group Inc.【原文：Some of Altice International Sarl’s unsecured creditors have hired Jefferies Financial Group Inc. and Milbank LLP as advisers ahead of debt talks with the company, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 英国隐形税率将使 500 多万人进入税率超过 40% 的阶层
item.description: 英国财政大臣雷切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）延长了冻结收入起征点的政策，到下一个十年开始时，约有 540 万工人将被推入 40% 至 45% 的高税率阶层。【原文：Some 5.4 million workers will have been pushed into higher tax brackets of between 40% and 45% by the start of the next decade after Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves extended a policy of freezing income thresholds.】

item.title: 随着天然气成本攀升，美国人支付的电费也创下历史新高
item.description: 根据美国能源信息署的数据，在电价创下近两年来最大涨幅之后，美国家庭支付的电费比以往任何时候都要高。【原文：American households are paying more than ever before for electricity after prices surged the most in almost two years, according to the US Energy Information Administration.】

item.title: 申请失业救济人数意外下降，国债反弹受阻
item.description: 由于新公布的美国劳动力市场数据强于预期，国债连续四天的反弹在周三陷入停滞，10 年期国债收益率重回 4% 以上。【原文：A four-day rally in Treasuries stalled on Wednesday, sending the 10-year yield back above 4% as fresh US labor market data came in stronger than expected.】

item.title: 华尔街乐观情绪推动 J&J 向 5000 亿美元市值迈进
item.description: 强生公司的股票市场估值濒临 5000 亿美元，因为投资者提高了对该公司应对其主要牛皮癣药物销售额下降的策略能否奏效的赌注。【原文：Johnson & Johnson’s stock market valuation is flirting with $500 billion as investors raise their bets that firm’s strategy to cope with eroding sales for its major psoriasis drug will pan out.】
